title: Why does everyone orgasm at the thought of urf?
body: I just don't understand what the appeal is. I've been playing League WELL before Urf ever existed, and to this day I've only played it 5 times total and I've hated every game of it. I used to just pick Yasuo, so I can handicap myself and make it a little fun, but then because of tryharding babies that don't realize its a **JOKE** mode, Riot made it all random. Can someone PLEASE explain the appeal of just spamming your keyboard blindly? It's just boring and repetitive. Theres no sense of reward for outplaying an opponent. And now due to all random, you can't even get a champion you find fun. Youre forced to play bullshit thats either Broken, or mediocre.

Yasuo is a direct descendant of URF as an experimental platform.

Its almost like Urf was supposed to be a April fools joke, where everyone was broken and you could use who ever you wanted to have fun, and then little babies that find randomly mashing keys fun ruined it by trying to tryhard and find whats over powered.

I admit I've found the mode less and less fun each time it's come up.  The first time... it was a blast.  No one knew anything, it was always "who else would be stupid on this?"
The second time, people had found the broken champs and made it go from a fun mode to "oh look, ANOTHER hecarim/shaco/wukong/etc"

The random bit was nice, but the novelty of the game mode wore off - it can never be as fun because the first time it broke all the rules and no one knew how to handle it.
People figured out the broken stuff within a day. Riot even had to permaban those champions towards the end of the event because no one played anything else.
While true, it wasn't on the level of seeing the same 5 or so champs in every game.  People were still mostly playing for fun.
I don't know, I saw at least a Hecarim and Sona every single game.

It's a spoof mode. It's loosely balanced. There's no ranking. There is no consistency to the availability of the mode to allow for people to develope any kind of resonating strategy. It's a spam fest for the lol's. 

Anyone tryharding/raging at this mode have issues. It doesn't even make sense to tryhard. Half your opponents are not even trying hard and are just having fun. This automatically nullifies any sense of competition. 

Its like some dude crashing a party when they're playing a silly ass game of hungry hungry hippos or some mindless equivalent and talking shit and getting up in their faces. Nobody cares. Its a silly ass game lol
I never really saw the appeal, played it once 3 years ago, never played it since.
I don't like URF either, but that may be because none of the champs I play are any good there. I'm not good enough at this game to play champs randomly either.
Because it lets them pretend that they're good at the game.

They just want to wham bam jam fight every second and try to come out alive.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LpiUEmxA,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-08-12T03:41:32.023+0000)

I guess you missed the part where I said I picked him to enjoy it. Spamming shit blindly is garbage. Yasuo actually makes you require some form of thought pattern in the garbage mode.

I don't just orgasm at the thought of urf, I think outside the box and orgasm at the thought of people orgasming at the thought of urf.

As for the actual topic, I'm under the assumption it's because URF essentially allows you to "exploit" and enjoy all the broken features with certain characters in a controlled environment. Karthus players can enjoy his ulti on a ridiculously low cooldown, mobile characters like riven/lucian can try to perma-kite enemies. Hell, even TF players can go for infinite q spam with rylai's and gank three lanes simultaneously. While broken characters do exist in the game, URF shifts the focus so that all characters are theoretically "broken" making it a much more fair environment.

Because Riot has conditioned people to love SR unconditionally. Which means SR clones are likewise loved unconditionally.
Sheep are as sheep do.
And to hell with other game modes that Riot will neglect and ignore anyways.

I'm gonna admit too, URF just doesn't have the same feeling as previous years. Even with the randomness, I think I've just grown to dislike losing because other people getting luckier. The feeling probably comes from Magic Drafts.

URF is actually better balanced in terms of game length, income and attackspeed. The cooldowns are a bit excessive, if it were like 70% CD and 25% original mana costs it could replace normal league play entirely.
